channel.title: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)
channel.description:
I have been gone for almost a year because these kind of sites are really not my thing but I just wanted to come back and show what I have learned so far. I can't really demonstrate web design because I have been learning it myself but I have been doing visual basic at school and I have 100 in that class but here is my attempt for a moparisthebest front page I will work on it more in my spare time but its basic html and I did the images myself tell me your opinions.
[url=http://wiebelhausdesign.xtreemhost.com/moparisthebest3/]wiebelhausdesign.xtreemhost.com/moparisthebest3/[/url] Updated Again
Please no immature remarks, which is one of the reason why I left here. I will add css sheet later to do the footer and frontpage text.
BTW the links are dead, Ill put them tommorrow.
ALSO it does say moparscape that is really my mistake, don't flame me about it, It was what I used to do here 3 years ago, before high school.

item.title: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Unhandled:

If you’re not an idiot, you wouldn’t use a font that isn’t available on any standard system. CSS allows you to specify “serif” and “sans-serif” for a reason you know.

Im not using ethier of those, besides the facts those are font types.

Read full topic

item.title: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)
item.dc:creator: @Server-Unknown.Net Server-Unknown.Net
item.description:
@Server-Unknown.Net wrote:

I just wanna give you a tip,
Best thing to do if you want to find colors you like, just go to a really awesome site that you like. Like http://veerle.duoh.com/, I used those colors and tweaked them up a little as you can see on my website that I’m currently making:

www.jarod.b.angelfire.com

Really good thing to do for a starter such as you and myself, that way you know what to do in the future as a more experienced web developer.

Read full topic
item.source: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)

item.title: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:41, topic:238649”][quote author=magma link=topic=314919.msg2516763#msg2516763 date=1225655570]
The advantages of using separate images outweigh overlaying text imo. For a start it looks better and as pwnd_ said, the font must be installed or it could look strange. It doesn’t exactly take more than five seconds to load the page anyway, unless you’re on 56k
[/quote]
Bullshit, who wants to go into photoshop every time they need to add a link. You have to worry about alt tags, and dynamically generating the text would be far more trouble than it’s worth.
Regardless of the speed of the connection, it’s inefficient.[/quote]

I like photoshop!

Read full topic
item.source: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)

item.title: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

On another topic

The advantages of using separate images outweigh overlaying text imo. For a start it looks better and as pwnd_ said, the font must be installed or it could look strange. It doesn’t exactly take more than five seconds to load the page anyway, unless you’re on 56k

Bullshit, who wants to go into photoshop every time they need to add a link. You have to worry about alt tags, and dynamically generating the text would be far more trouble than it’s worth.
Regardless of the speed of the connection, it’s inefficient.

Read full topic
item.source: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)

item.title: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“belbn, post:37, topic:238649”]This website is insanely awesome! I love the quantum vector shader input/output sequintial dataflow channel you used at the top.

P.S.-It fucking sucks![/quote]

Fuck off. I don’t see your website.

Mwiebelhaus, I like it so far, but I have some suggestions:

[ul][li]Make it XHTML 1.0 Strict (Just a preference of mine)[/li]
[li]CSS hover buttons[/li]
[li]Use of DIVS[/li]
[li]Less choppy background (like Unhandled’s)[/li][/ul]

I’ll help you with any/all of these if you’d like.

Read full topic

item.title: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:35, topic:238649”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=314919.msg2510133#msg2510133 date=1225234611]

[quote author=Pwnd link=topic=314919.msg2510088#msg2510088 date=1225233475]

[quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=314919.msg2509912#msg2509912 date=1225229001]

Why do you use a seperate image for every link and its rollover? Use the same background and let the text just be written. Only thing I don’t like is either the nav needs more padding or the text needs to be smaller. The rest is nice. Good work!
[/quote]Only logical reason I can think of is a non-supported font.

Or so if someone trys to copy your website they will have to make new images even though it would probably take someone 10 minutes to make something like that, or less?
[/quote]Or they can just download them…?

I mean like, in order to change the text they would have to edit the images.
[/quote]Ah, indeed. That’s true, however, they could cut part of the image and take Unhandled’s approach ;D[/quote]

=))

Read full topic

Why do you use a seperate image for every link and its rollover? Use the same background and let the text just be written. Only thing I don’t like is either the nav needs more padding or the text needs to be smaller. The rest is nice. Good work!
[/quote]Only logical reason I can think of is a non-supported font.

Or so if someone trys to copy your website they will have to make new images even though it would probably take someone 10 minutes to make something like that, or less?
[/quote]Or they can just download them…?

item.title: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:26, topic:238649”][code]

[/code]

Nope.
Use CSS to do the hovering. Just use text, then a single image for the background. Your site will be well over 9000 times more maintainable.[/quote]

Can you show me how to do that, when I tried to do css it would make my buttons go on separate lines thats why I had to do java script

Ethier way theres not much to maintain, look at the one we have now, but this was the method I tried for CSS

http://www.learnwebdesignonline.com/menus-more-menus/css-rollover-buttons.htm

Read full topic

item.title: My Moparisthebest Website (UPDATED AGAIN)(NOW WITH HOVER BUTTONS)
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

<SCRIPT LANGUAGE="JavaScript"> 
 
<!-- This script and many more are available free online at --> 
<!-- The JavaScript Source!! http://javascript.internet.com --> 
 
<!-- Begin
 
image1 = new Image();
image1.src = "HomeHover.png";
 
image2 = new Image();
image2.src = "ForumsHover.png";
 
image3 = new Image();
image3.src = "AboutMeHover.png";
 
image4 = new Image();
image4.src = "PackageManagersHover.png";
 
image5 = new Image();
image5.src = "ContactUsHover.png";
 
image6 = new Image();
image6.src = "ServerStatusHover.png";
 
image7 = new Image();
image7.src = "IRCChatHover.png";
 
// End --> 
 
</script>

Nope.
Use CSS to do the hovering. Just use text, then a single image for the background. Your site will be well over 9000 times more maintainable.

Read full topic
